description:
The stage is Asakusa. One day, three 2nd-year middle school students — Kazuki Yasaka, Tooi Kuji, and Enta Jinnai — meet a mysterious kappa-like creature named Keppi, who forcibly takes their shirikodama (a mythical organ kappa steal through a person's anus) and transforms the boys into kappa.

Keppi informs them, "If you wish to return to your former selves, you must connect in 'that way' and bring me the shirikodama of zombies." Will the three boys be able to connect as they steal shirikodama from zombies?! Meanwhile, two policemen — Reo Niiboshi and Mabu Akutsu — are up to something at the police box where they are stationed.

(Source: Official Website)

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Football
tags.description: Centers around the sport of football (known in the USA as "soccer").

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

title.native: レオとマブ ～ふたりはさらざんまい～
アンソロジー みんなでさらざんまい

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikuni_noise/) | [Website](https://ikuni.net)

**Kunihiko Ikuhara**, nicknamed Ikuni, was born December 21, 1964 in Osaka Prefecture, Japan. Ikuhara is an idiosyncratic, postmodern anime director that had a significant impact on the development of anime styles from the 90s and onward. His surrealist, psychosexual works are why fans often compare him to [David Lynch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Lynch). Although he is a beloved creative mind, Ikuhara is very hard to deal with and is an overwhelming perfectionist, leading to a small, but important catalog of work. 

**Style**
Ikuhara is an incredibly unique artist, but draws a lot of influence from [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/Osamu-Dezaki), making interesting anime that focuses on maximal impact on minimal drawings. Key examples would be [*Onii-sama e...*](https://anilist.co/anime/795/Oniisama-e/) and [*Versailles no Bara*](https://anilist.co/anime/338/Versailles-no-Bara/). Their directing also show similarities in how they try to provoke feelings from the viewer. One particular recurring trait would be [their Dutch angles](https://aninomiyako.files.wordpress.com/2011/10/obliqueness.jpg?w=500&h=561), which is used to depict unrest and disorientation. 

Ikuhara's usual stylistic and narrative devices include pretense, deception, metaphors, bluffs, and repetition of gags. His iconography is consistent to the point people made [humorous bingo's](https://i.imgur.com/vlVmMu6.jpg) for his works. His enthusiasm and history with theater led to his most apparent stylistic trait, namely a stage play-like presentation with a mise-en-scène policy of showing only what is necessary, maintaining a tight control of his canvas at all times. Images themselves become a strong narrative tool. The themes of his work often tackle adolescence and LGBTQ-issues and turns them into cartoonish fables that gets to the heart of the issues.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kayo_006)

Ishikawa is an animator currently affiliated with the animation studio [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA).

Scriptwriter and production manager affiliated with [Lapin Track](https://anilist.co/studio/6213/Lapin-Track). Originating as a production manager for [Brain's Base](https://anilist.co/studio/112/Brains-Base) before slowly transitioning into a scriptwriter under them.

Founder of animation studio Lapin Track alongside [Masakazu Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/148153/Masakazu-Watanabe).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YukaliHashimoto) | [Blog (jp)](http://blog.livedoor.jp/marianne_amplifier/)

She is a composer, arranger and synthesizer programmer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kayo_006)

Ishikawa is an animator currently affiliated with the animation studio [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA).

__Members:__
- Maguro Taniguchi (lead vocals, rhythm guitar) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboonmaguro) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/taniguchi_maguro)
- Hayato Koga (lead guitar, backing vocals) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboontuna) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanaboontuna)
- Takahiro Koizumi (drums) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanaboonkoicha)

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanaboon_official_insta) |  [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_kanaboon) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/KANABOONVEVO/) | [Official Website](https://sp.kanaboon.jp/) 

A Japanese rock band formed in 2008, currently associated with Ki/oon Music. They've had four albums reach the top ten on the weekly Oricon Albums Chart. They have also had five singles reach the top ten on the weekly Oricon Singles Chart.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Genres:__ Alternative rock, Pop rock
__Labels:__ Poppo Express - Epic Records Japan

[Official Site](http://thepeggies.jp/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/the_peggies) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3jNmNbqOSajU-pT36HnTJA) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/the_peggies/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/thepeggiesofficial) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@the_peggies_official) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_peggies) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_peggies)

*the peggies* was a Japanese all-woman rock band from Kawasaki, Kanagawa, Japan, formed in 2011.

On July 8, 2022, the band announced that they would be going on indefinite hiatus in September the same year, following the release of a best of compilation album *MMY* and final tour *"the peggies tour 2022 My White"* concluding on September 30, 2022.

__Members:__
• [Yuuho Kitazawa](https://anilist.co/staff/180282/Yuuho-Kitazawa) (vocals and guitarist, songwriter) • [Twitter](https://x.com/poppoexpress)
• Makiko Ishiwatari (bass) • [Twitter](https://x.com/mega_makiko)
• Miku Onuki (drummer) • [Twitter](https://x.com/minimiku0423)

Began his career in animation at [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/), where he worked on projects like [Genius Party Beyond](https://anilist.co/anime/6795/). In 2011, he was handpicked by then president [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/) to join [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) as a producer. He then went on to work as an animation producer on numerous titles such as [Kids on the Slope](https://anilist.co/anime/12531/), [Terror in Resonance](https://anilist.co/anime/20661/) and [Shingeki no Bahamut: Genesis](https://anilist.co/anime/20590/).

In April 2016, Maruyama handed Ootsuka the reigns of the studio and he took on the role of a producer and the CEO.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikuni_noise/) | [Website](https://ikuni.net)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/lvdctv) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lvdctv/) | [Website](https://lovedesign.jp/)

Graphic designer specializing in various design works.

Animation producer affiliated with [Lapin Track](https://anilist.co/studio/6213/Lapin-Track). Originating as a production manager for [Brain's Base](https://anilist.co/studio/112/Brains-Base).

Founder of animation studio Lapin Track alongside [Teruko Utsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/128817).
